cards.content: Check pumpkin patch for ripe pumpkins - Walk through the entire patch and mark ready-to-harvest pumpkins
Prepare harvesting tools - Sharpen knives, clean wheelbarrows, and gather collection baskets
Check weather forecast - Ensure dry conditions for optimal harvesting this week
Harvest jack-o'-lantern pumpkins - Cut stems 2 inches from pumpkin, handle carefully to avoid bruising
Sort pumpkins by size - Separate small, medium, and large pumpkins for different markets
Clean harvested pumpkins - Remove dirt and debris, inspect for damage or rot
Cure pumpkins in sunlight - Place in sunny area for 10 days to harden skin for storage
Load pumpkins for farmers market - Transport 50 large pumpkins to Saturday market
Set up Halloween display - Arrange pumpkins with hay bales and corn stalks for spooky effect
Plant winter cover crops - Sow rye and clover in harvested fields to prevent soil erosion
Prepare corn maze - Trim pathways and add Halloween decorations for October visitors
Stock up on apple cider supplies - Order apples, spices, and bottles for cider production
Service tractor before winter - Change oil, check belts, and winterize engine
Repair greenhouse heating system - Fix broken heater before first frost arrives
Plan haunted hayride route - Map out spooky trail through woods with scary decorations
Harvest sweet corn crop - Successfully harvested 200 dozen ears for local market
Build scarecrow army - Created 12 scarecrows to protect remaining crops from birds
